paragraph: WRAPTEXT Walmart International CEO WRAPTEXT Thank you , Greg . WRAPTEXT I ’ m pleased with our performance in International as we ’ ve remained WRAPTEXT committed to the strategic priorities I outlined a year ago . We ’ ve been able WRAPTEXT to produce solid results and operating income growth , despite operating in WRAPTEXT a very challenging , competitive retail environment . WRAPTEXT As one of our key priorities , we continue to accelerate our e- WRAPTEXT commerce business by offering multiple ways for our customers to shop . WRAPTEXT Whether in stores , online , pickup or mobile , we aim to give our customers WRAPTEXT the ability to shop in whichever way they want . We ’ ve also made progress WRAPTEXT in building a platform for sustainable growth in China , and have WRAPTEXT experienced success in improving our overall price perception , as well as WRAPTEXT the quality of our fresh offering . We also continue to make progress on our WRAPTEXT commitment of actively managing our existing portfolio . You ’ ve seen us WRAPTEXT make strategic decisions such as closing underperforming stores and WRAPTEXT divesting non-core parts of our business in order to strengthen our WRAPTEXT 20 WRAPTEXT foundation . Our markets remain focused on key strategic priorities , and I ’ m WRAPTEXT optimistic about our position going into the new year . WRAPTEXT Now for our financial results…In the fourth quarter , net sales grew 3.0 WRAPTEXT percent on a constant currency basis . However , with the U.S. dollar at WRAPTEXT historic highs , we faced significant currency headwinds of $ 2.6 billion , WRAPTEXT resulting in a 3.9 percent sales decline on a reported basis . Of our five WRAPTEXT largest countries , Mexico , Canada and Brazil delivered positive comp sales WRAPTEXT for the quarter . Comps declined in both the U.K. and China due primarily to WRAPTEXT food deflation and intense competition in the U.K. , and government WRAPTEXT austerity measures and deflation in key categories in China . Comp sales WRAPTEXT growth was strong in all other markets as well . WRAPTEXT As Claire mentioned , there were certain discrete items disclosed in WRAPTEXT the previous year , which have a significant impact on our year over year WRAPTEXT operating income comparison . For financial year ending15 , our fourth WRAPTEXT quarter results were negatively impacted by Japan store closure costs of WRAPTEXT $ 148 million . Overall , operating income increased 79.6 percent on a WRAPTEXT constant currency basis and 66.4 percent on a reported basis . Excluding WRAPTEXT the previous and current years discrete items , we grew operating income , WRAPTEXT on a constant currency basis , by 14.2 percent . WRAPTEXT For the full year , sales grew 3.6 percent on a constant currency basis , WRAPTEXT while the strong U.S. dollar resulted in a full year sales decline of 0.3 WRAPTEXT percent on a reported basis , reflecting over a $ 5 billion currency impact . WRAPTEXT Full year operating income grew 24.1 percent on a constant currency basis WRAPTEXT and 19.8 percent on a reported basis . Excluding the items mentioned WRAPTEXT above , operating income grew 9.3 percent on a constant currency basis , WRAPTEXT outpacing full year sales growth . WRAPTEXT We made progress in reducing inventory levels during the quarter WRAPTEXT and dropped the growth rate over 250 basis points versus the previous WRAPTEXT quarter , to a 4.6 percent growth on a constant currency basis . We had WRAPTEXT positive momentum on inventory management heading into the new year . WRAPTEXT 21 WRAPTEXT Now let ’ s discuss individual results for our largest markets . Comp WRAPTEXT sales and growth rates are presented on a constant currency basis only . In WRAPTEXT all countries except Brazil and China , results are inclusive of e-commerce . WRAPTEXT Slides 8 and 9 of the presentation summarize financial details . WRAPTEXT The UK market remained very competitive during the quarter , with WRAPTEXT grocery inflation falling to a record low of negative 0.9 percent over the 12 WRAPTEXT weeks ended January 4 , according to Kantar . Total market growth of 0.6 WRAPTEXT percent was a slight improvement over the previous quarter , boosted by WRAPTEXT Christmas sales and increased discretionary spending from lower fuel WRAPTEXT prices . However , overall market trends remain relatively weak . According WRAPTEXT to Kantar , Asda , along with the other big grocers , lost share to hard WRAPTEXT discounters for the quarter . WRAPTEXT U.K. sales declined 1.7 percent and comp sales declined 2.5 percent , WRAPTEXT excluding fuel . Several competitors held a Black Friday event for the first WRAPTEXT time and others continued intense vouchering , which led to increased WRAPTEXT competition versus a year ago . Asda online sales remained strong , while WRAPTEXT George home continued to register double-digit growth . Despite the top WRAPTEXT line pressures , Asda was able to grow income ahead of sales . WRAPTEXT Now turning to Canada , which had a very solid fourth quarter WRAPTEXT performance . Sales grew 4.1 percent , with comp sales increasing 1.8 WRAPTEXT percent , marking this the third consecutive quarter of positive comps . Price WRAPTEXT investments and increased consumer spending contributed to improved WRAPTEXT trends in sales . We reported strong comp sales in food , health & wellness WRAPTEXT and consumables . While general merchandise and apparel sales improved WRAPTEXT versus prior quarter results , they were still below the rate of growth in the WRAPTEXT market . Our fresh business also continues to accelerate , resulting in the WRAPTEXT highest comp sales for the year in quarter 4 . Canada had a strong holiday WRAPTEXT season overall , with the online business up 38.5 percent . Walmart Canada WRAPTEXT grew 43 basis points of market share in food , consumables and health and WRAPTEXT wellness combined , as reported by Nielsen for the 12-week period ending WRAPTEXT January 24 . WRAPTEXT 22 WRAPTEXT Canada completed a restructuring in the quarter to simplify home WRAPTEXT office operations . This , along with continued investments in e-commerce WRAPTEXT and pricing resulted in a decline in operating income . Overall , we ’ re WRAPTEXT pleased with the positive sales trend we ’ ve seen in our Canadian WRAPTEXT operations and we expect the momentum to continue . WRAPTEXT Next we ’ ll discuss Walmex , which released their quarterly results on WRAPTEXT February 17 . Please note the Walmex release is under IFRS and the WRAPTEXT results here are under U.S. GAAP ; thus some numbers will differ .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Consolidated Walmex sales grew 3.4 percent , with positive comp WRAPTEXT sales in both Mexico and Central America . Walmex leveraged expenses WRAPTEXT for the quarter and grew operating income faster than sales . WRAPTEXT Mexico sales increased 3.0 percent , and the comp sales were up 0.1 WRAPTEXT percent for the quarter . According to ANTAD , the entire market WRAPTEXT experienced slower comp growth in the fourth quarter of 0.7 percent in self- WRAPTEXT service . Walmart Mexico comps , excluding Sam ’ s Club , exceeded the WRAPTEXT market by 80 basis points . Performance was especially strong in our small WRAPTEXT format , Bodega Aurrera Express , which outperformed the market by 750 WRAPTEXT basis points . WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club growth lagged the market by approximately 330 basis WRAPTEXT points . However , we ’ re encouraged by the improving top line trends at WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s , as December comp sales were the strongest of the year . Sam ’ s WRAPTEXT Club remains a focus area and we will continue to accelerate initiatives to WRAPTEXT improve the business . WRAPTEXT Next , let ’ s talk about Brazil…Brazil continued sales momentum in Q4 , WRAPTEXT growing net sales and comp sales by 3.1 percent . Holiday sales were WRAPTEXT driven by strong performances in both food and consumables . Strategic WRAPTEXT and targeted pricing resulted in margin favorability for the quarter . WRAPTEXT Management also continued to drive labor productivity and control WRAPTEXT expenses . While we are seeing some positive results , there ’ s still work to WRAPTEXT be done in our turnaround plan . WRAPTEXT 23 WRAPTEXT Moving to China ... Ongoing headwinds from government austerity WRAPTEXT measures , reduction in gift card sales and continued deflation in key WRAPTEXT categories continue to pose challenges in the market . Walmart China ’ s Q4 WRAPTEXT net sales declined 0.7 percent and comp sales declined 2.3 percent , WRAPTEXT partially due to Chinese New Year falling nearly three weeks later than last WRAPTEXT year . We increased market share in the hypermarket category for the WRAPTEXT eighth consecutive quarter , according to Nielsen , for the period ended WRAPTEXT December 31 . We expect market headwinds to continue in the new year , WRAPTEXT but we ’ re confident that we ’ ll continue to accelerate growth in this important WRAPTEXT market . WRAPTEXT Over the year , China has made great progress in strengthening the WRAPTEXT core business . Our portfolio is now more focused and stronger with the WRAPTEXT opening of 24 new hypermarket stores and 1 additional Sam ’ s Club , in WRAPTEXT addition to completing the store closure program announced last year . The WRAPTEXT distribution center expansion project and the centralization of deliveries to WRAPTEXT DCs were finalized within the quarter , resulting in a distribution network for WRAPTEXT fresh that provides coverage for all of our stores in China for the first time . WRAPTEXT These initiatives drive efficiency , reduce costs and shorten the lead time to WRAPTEXT get products on the shelf . Having control over our own distribution network WRAPTEXT allows us to better monitor the quality and the safety of our products . WRAPTEXT Additionally , the ‘ We Operate for Less ’ ( WO4L ) and the ‘ We Buy for Less ’ WRAPTEXT ( WB4L ) programs in China have saved over $ 150 million over the course of WRAPTEXT the year . WRAPTEXT Finally , let ’ s discuss e-commerce performance across the globe . We WRAPTEXT remain focused on innovating and providing solutions for our customers WRAPTEXT seeking convenience . This quarter we ’ ve made even more progress and WRAPTEXT I ’ m very excited about the impact we ’ ve made in online retail . In Japan , we WRAPTEXT automated the order picking process to fulfill Seiyu.com grocery orders WRAPTEXT more efficiently and sustainably . We ’ re testing new offerings , such as WRAPTEXT “ grab ‘ n go ” lockers in Canada . In India , we ’ re continuing the rollout of an WRAPTEXT online offering to business-to-business members and expect to reach all WRAPTEXT members by the end of next year . WRAPTEXT 24 WRAPTEXT Yihaodian , our e-commerce business in China , benefited from WRAPTEXT investments in the supply chain and promotional events . Traffic increased WRAPTEXT more than 40 percent and average ticket improved as well . The fourth WRAPTEXT quarter was highlighted by a successful Singles Day promotion in WRAPTEXT November , generating strong sales and traffic growth , aided by an increase WRAPTEXT in orders from mobile devices . WRAPTEXT In Brazil , e-commerce sales growth was strong again this quarter , WRAPTEXT driven by strong sales in large appliances and wireless , where low cost WRAPTEXT smart phones helped drive sales growth of more than double the same WRAPTEXT period last year . Promotions fueled sales growth with the Black Friday and WRAPTEXT 72-hour events , delivering strong comp sales . Traffic via our mobile app WRAPTEXT nearly tripled on Black Friday . WRAPTEXT Looking ahead , we will continue to innovate and execute our strategic WRAPTEXT plan . I ’ m amazed by how similar our customers ’ needs are around the WRAPTEXT world -- value , assortment and convenience are paramount . We will WRAPTEXT remain focused on saving our customers money by expanding our private WRAPTEXT label offering , improving product sourcing and driving cost out of our WRAPTEXT operations so that we can invest back into price . We know convenience WRAPTEXT means different things to customers , at different times . It could mean WRAPTEXT shopping online , home grocery delivery , a one-stop shop experience or a WRAPTEXT drive-through pickup , and we ’ re innovating to provide customers more WRAPTEXT shopping options than ever . No matter the shopper preference , Walmart WRAPTEXT will continue to strive to be the destination of choice . WRAPTEXT Our objectives for this year will continue to build upon a foundation WRAPTEXT that ’ s been established . In financial year ended16 , we ’ re committed to : WRAPTEXT Actively managing the existing portfolio WRAPTEXT Driving comp sales WRAPTEXT Accelerating e-commerce WRAPTEXT 25 WRAPTEXT Delivering market priorities , including establishing a platform for WRAPTEXT sustainable growth in China , moving forward with the turnaround WRAPTEXT efforts in Brazil and re-energizing the business in Mexico WRAPTEXT And lastly -- strengthening enablers , which means being the lowest WRAPTEXT cost operator , building world-class talent and building trust WRAPTEXT Let me close by thanking our nearly 800,000 international associates WRAPTEXT around the world for delivering a strong performance in financial year WRAPTEXT ending15 . As I reflect on the past year , I ’ m humbled by what our team has WRAPTEXT accomplished and their relentless focus on saving customers money . WRAPTEXT I look forward to updating you on our results in the coming months . WRAPTEXT Now , I ’ ll turn it over to Roz for the update on Sam ’ s . Roz …

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Thanks Dave . WRAPTEXT I ’ d like to start by echoing our excitement at Sam ’ s Club regarding the WRAPTEXT company ’ s announcement today to boost the starting wage for our full-time WRAPTEXT and part-time hourly associates . We believe we provide our associates WRAPTEXT with an excellent opportunity to pursue careers in retail . WRAPTEXT Because our business model at Sam ’ s Club differs from Walmart WRAPTEXT stores , beginning in the first half of the fiscal year , we will offer a starting WRAPTEXT hourly wage of $ 9.50 , which is above the federal minimum wage , unless WRAPTEXT there is a higher state-mandated minimum wage . This will ensure all WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club hourly associates are paid above the federal minimum wage . WRAPTEXT We believe this investment in our associates will help us attract , retain and WRAPTEXT develop top-notch talent , and will allow us to continue to deliver WRAPTEXT outstanding , award-winning service to our members . WRAPTEXT 26 WRAPTEXT Now on to Q4… I want to thank our Sam ’ s Club associates for WRAPTEXT delivering the best performance of the year this quarter , providing WRAPTEXT momentum going into Fiscal 16 . Over the last four quarters , we saw WRAPTEXT meaningful acceleration , culminating in a comp sales increase , without fuel , WRAPTEXT of 2.0 percent for the 13-week period ended January 30 . Strong holiday WRAPTEXT execution , combined with our strategic investments in member value , WRAPTEXT merchandise relevance , and the integration of digital and physical , boosted WRAPTEXT our performance . WRAPTEXT Our investments in membership value initiatives enabled us to grow WRAPTEXT membership income by over 8 percent this quarter . Our Plus penetration is WRAPTEXT at historic highs , as Plus members are seeing the benefits from our Cash WRAPTEXT Rewards program . Across the club , ALL members are seeing the benefits WRAPTEXT of Instant Savings and the 5/3/1 MasterCard . We will anniversary the WRAPTEXT introduction of Plus Cash Rewards and the 5/3/1 MasterCard in June 2015 , WRAPTEXT so we expect these programs to continue driving membership income WRAPTEXT moving forward . WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s net sales , including fuel , were $ 14.9 billion , up 1.3 percent WRAPTEXT over last year . This was impacted by the approximately 25 percent decline WRAPTEXT in fuel prices , with gallons sold up approximately 8 percent . Our gross WRAPTEXT profit rate increased 23 basis points due to higher margin on fuel . WRAPTEXT Operating expenses as a percentage of sales decreased by 50 basis WRAPTEXT points . Operating income increased 29.1 percent to $ 510 million , which WRAPTEXT includes a $ 41 million increase in fuel profit . WRAPTEXT Our 500-plus fuel stations provided value to members through WRAPTEXT competitive pricing , and the 5/3/1 MasterCard holders benefit from an WRAPTEXT additional 5 percent off all gas purchases . WRAPTEXT Given the volatility in fuel prices , the remainder of this discussion will WRAPTEXT exclude fuel . Additionally , for comparisons , please recall that last year we WRAPTEXT had certain items impacting our results , which included : WRAPTEXT 27 WRAPTEXT a $ 39-million charge to gross profit , due to an adjustment to our WRAPTEXT product warranty liabilities WRAPTEXT a $ 59-million charge to operating expenses for a new in-club WRAPTEXT staffing restructuring and the closure of one club WRAPTEXT a $ 24-million gain in other income for the sale of two real estate WRAPTEXT properties . WRAPTEXT In Q4 , net sales grew 3.7 percent and we delivered comp sales of 2.0 WRAPTEXT percent , driven by traffic growth of 1.5 percent and ticket of 0.5 percent . WRAPTEXT The Savings member continues to drive traffic . We have lapped last year ’ s WRAPTEXT SNAP reductions and benefitted from favorable weather this quarter . Retail WRAPTEXT inflation across the club has moderated slightly since the previous quarter . WRAPTEXT Our gross profit declined 32 basis points versus last year , due to the WRAPTEXT planned impact of Plus Cash Rewards and pressure from merchandise WRAPTEXT mix , which were offset by last year ’ s product warranty charge . Without the WRAPTEXT comparative benefit of the product warranty charge last year , gross profit WRAPTEXT declined 61 basis points . As discussed previously , the rollout of Plus Cash WRAPTEXT Rewards will pressure gross profit in the first half of fiscal year 2016 . WRAPTEXT Operating expenses were well managed in the quarter and we WRAPTEXT leveraged 82 basis points . Even without the comparative benefit of last WRAPTEXT year ’ s discrete items , we leveraged expenses . We had disciplined WRAPTEXT expense management in a number of areas , including the optimization of WRAPTEXT the club staffing model earlier this year . WRAPTEXT Membership & other income grew by 1.4 percent , compared to last WRAPTEXT year , which factors in the real estate gain . Without the $ 24 million real WRAPTEXT estate gain last year , membership & other income was up 8.7 percent . WRAPTEXT Operating income was up 19.4 percent to $ 456 million . Without the WRAPTEXT comparative benefit of last year ’ s items , our operating income was flat to WRAPTEXT last year . We are still very happy with our overall performance for the WRAPTEXT quarter , given the significant investments in membership value initiatives , WRAPTEXT 28 WRAPTEXT such as Plus Cash Rewards . And , with good expense management and WRAPTEXT improvements in membership income , we believe we have great WRAPTEXT momentum for fiscal 2016 . WRAPTEXT I also want to highlight the team ’ s efforts around working capital . We WRAPTEXT reduced total inventory by 3.5 percent , while simultaneously growing our WRAPTEXT fleet by 16 clubs during the year . Moreover , I am confident in the quality of WRAPTEXT our inventory for this year . WRAPTEXT At Sam ’ s Club , relevant merchandise is a critical component in WRAPTEXT member engagement , and we continue to improve performance across the WRAPTEXT box . Our merchants are pushing hard to introduce newness and capture WRAPTEXT consumer trends , while providing the price leadership and assortment that WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club is known for . WRAPTEXT Sales of our fresh food business grew positive low single-digits this WRAPTEXT quarter . Performance was led by meat , due to inflation and a strong value WRAPTEXT proposition . A challenged area was produce , where weather created WRAPTEXT supply issues . WRAPTEXT Dry grocery & beverage delivered a positive low single-digit comp , WRAPTEXT with highlights in newness and healthy-for-you items . We doubled the WRAPTEXT organic portfolio since the previous quarter , and members are responding WRAPTEXT positively to new , healthy beverage options . WRAPTEXT Let ’ s continue with health & wellness , which posted a positive mid- WRAPTEXT single digit comp . Sam ’ s Club is a destination for our members ’ health- WRAPTEXT care needs – and we see that clearly in our pharmacy comps , which drove WRAPTEXT the category due to both script growth and branded prescription inflation . WRAPTEXT Our OTC business , especially our healthy assortment of nutrition bars and WRAPTEXT protein , also did well . WRAPTEXT 29 WRAPTEXT We ’ ve seen an uptick in our consumables business , which posted a WRAPTEXT positive low single-digit comp . This is an area where members consistently WRAPTEXT see value through our private brand offerings , improved pack sizes , and

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Instant Savings . For example , members love the quality of our private WRAPTEXT brand Member ’ s Mark paper products . The disposable tabletop category WRAPTEXT continues to perform well , and we have introduced newness to improve the WRAPTEXT laundry and home care business . WRAPTEXT Home and apparel delivered a positive low single-digit comp . Our WRAPTEXT exciting assortment of toys was a highlight , drawing members into the club WRAPTEXT over the holidays . Apparel continues to show strength , driven by WRAPTEXT menswear and children ’ s clothing . WRAPTEXT Our underperforming category continues to be technology & WRAPTEXT entertainment , which posted a negative mid single-digit comp . This is an WRAPTEXT improvement versus last quarter , as a result of introducing the latest Ultra WRAPTEXT Hi-Def and 4K TV technologies , a strong value proposition on the iPhone 6 WRAPTEXT and 6+ , and an expanded wearables assortment . However , we need to WRAPTEXT make larger , faster strides . This year , our merchants are rebalancing the WRAPTEXT portfolio , which involves reallocating resources towards higher growth , WRAPTEXT higher excitement categories . WRAPTEXT Ancillary improved to a positive low single-digit comp , driven by WRAPTEXT growth in tobacco . We saw improved convenience store traffic trends , as WRAPTEXT we executed strategic pricing initiatives and benefitted from shifts in the WRAPTEXT competitive landscape . WRAPTEXT Moving to e-commerce , this quarter , SamsClub.com was integral in WRAPTEXT supporting our in-club holiday events , becoming a Cyber Week destination WRAPTEXT and offering online-only promotions that drew members from our physical WRAPTEXT clubs to our digital platforms . Dot-com delivered double-digit comps in both WRAPTEXT direct-to-home and Club Pickup , contributing approximately 40 basis points WRAPTEXT to the segment comp . WRAPTEXT 30 WRAPTEXT We ’ ve rebranded Click ‘ n ’ Pull to Club Pickup and enhanced the WRAPTEXT service to appeal to both Savings and Business members . Members have WRAPTEXT responded well to the re-launch of Club Pickup in all clubs , and we ’ ve seen WRAPTEXT accelerated performance compared to the previous quarter . The WRAPTEXT improvements we ’ ve made to our mobile and desktop platforms , along with WRAPTEXT enhancements in messaging , have boosted conversion rates across all WRAPTEXT platforms . WRAPTEXT This concludes our discussion on fourth quarter results . Let ’ s WRAPTEXT continue with the financial results for the full year , where we ’ ve seen WRAPTEXT meaningful , sustainable acceleration every quarter . WRAPTEXT With fuel , net sales were $ 58.0 billion , up 1.5 percent over last year . WRAPTEXT With fuel profit of $ 122 million , operating income for the year grew 7.2 WRAPTEXT percent to $ 2.0 billion . WRAPTEXT Net sales , excluding fuel , were $ 51.6 billion , up 2.1 percent . For the WRAPTEXT 52-week period ending January 30 , 2015 , comp sales increased 50 basis WRAPTEXT points , driven by traffic . WRAPTEXT While our investments in Cash Rewards for Plus members led to a WRAPTEXT gross profit rate decline of 38 basis points , we managed expenses well and WRAPTEXT leveraged 24 basis points . Membership income increased 10.3 percent , WRAPTEXT driving operating income of $ 1.9 billion , a 2.0 percent increase over last WRAPTEXT year . WRAPTEXT Fiscal 2016 is well under way and Sam ’ s Club is innovating the WRAPTEXT member experience through merchandise relevance and digital/physical WRAPTEXT integration . These two priorities are the key to membership engagement . I WRAPTEXT am confident that our strategic investments will not only differentiate us WRAPTEXT from our competitors , but , more importantly , continue enhancing our WRAPTEXT members ’ trust and loyalty . WRAPTEXT 31 WRAPTEXT Merchandise relevance is a critical enabler . Our goal is to ensure WRAPTEXT that members are surprised and delighted by relevant merchandise every WRAPTEXT time they come into the club or visit our website , in every category across WRAPTEXT the country . Combined with price leadership and newness , merchandise WRAPTEXT relevance will keep our members coming back for more . WRAPTEXT Our Fiscal 16 investment strategy reflects the importance of offering a WRAPTEXT seamless digital/physical club experience for members . I recently was at WRAPTEXT the grand opening of our new e-commerce facility in San Bruno , California WRAPTEXT where Jamie Iannone , who leads SamsClub.com , has invested in WRAPTEXT expanding his team of engineers and scientists . WRAPTEXT I am optimistic about our growth opportunities in both the digital and WRAPTEXT the physical -- and that ’ s why we plan to open 9-12 new and relocated WRAPTEXT clubs , and remodel between 55 and 60 clubs this year , while WRAPTEXT simultaneously investing in innovation at SamsClub.com . Knowing that our WRAPTEXT most engaged members want to shop with us both in our clubs and online , WRAPTEXT we will ensure a seamless set of access points for members . WRAPTEXT I am proud of how we finished out the year . For the 13- week period WRAPTEXT from January 31 through May 1 , we expect comp sales to increase WRAPTEXT between 1 and 2 percent . WRAPTEXT Now , I ’ ll turn things over to Neil for the e-commerce update . Neil…

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Walmart International WRAPTEXT Thank you , Greg . WRAPTEXT Over the past few months , I ’ ve had the opportunity to visit the majority of our WRAPTEXT markets , and I continue to be pleased with the progress I see . Overall , we ’ ve had WRAPTEXT a solid start to the fiscal year financially and continue to make progress on our key WRAPTEXT strategic priorities . As a reminder , these key priorities include : WRAPTEXT Actively managing the existing portfolio WRAPTEXT Driving comp sales WRAPTEXT Accelerating e-commerce WRAPTEXT Delivering market priorities – particularly in China , Brazil and Mexico WRAPTEXT And finally , strengthening key enablers – such as being the lowest cost WRAPTEXT operator , building world-class talent , and building trust WRAPTEXT Before we discuss the financials , here are a few highlights from the first WRAPTEXT quarter . First , I ’ m particularly pleased with our overall performance in Mexico , WRAPTEXT which not only had its strongest net quarterly sales growth in over two years , but WRAPTEXT also grew operating income faster than sales . Our results in Mexico were due to WRAPTEXT better comps in all key formats , including Sam ’ s Club . WRAPTEXT Also , I want to call out our performance in Canada , which had a positive WRAPTEXT comp for the fourth consecutive quarter . In addition to Canada and Mexico , we WRAPTEXT achieved comp growth in most of our other markets , as we remain committed to WRAPTEXT delivering positive comp sales across the board . I ’ m energized by the execution WRAPTEXT I ’ ve seen from our teams . WRAPTEXT 14 WRAPTEXT In addition , I ’ m excited about our efforts in accelerating e-commerce . In the WRAPTEXT U.K. , grocery home shopping continues to report double-digit comps , and we ’ re WRAPTEXT leveraging our U.K. experience in other markets across the globe . Earlier , Doug WRAPTEXT mentioned some of our change initiatives that we ’ re working on across the WRAPTEXT enterprise . One of these initiatives is built around this experience in grocery home WRAPTEXT shopping . We have a newly created “ International Acceleration Team ” based in WRAPTEXT the U.K. that is building close partnerships with our markets to speed up the WRAPTEXT adoption of grocery home shopping processes and technologies . We ’ re now WRAPTEXT working towards a common technology platform to better position us for the WRAPTEXT expansion of grocery home shopping . WRAPTEXT Now , let ’ s take a look at our first quarter results . In the first quarter , net WRAPTEXT sales grew 3.4 percent on a constant currency basis , partially benefitting by the WRAPTEXT timing of Chinese New Year and Easter . The U.S. dollar has remained at WRAPTEXT historically high levels , leading to a considerable currency impact of $ 3.3 billion , WRAPTEXT which led to a 6.6 percent sales decline on a reported basis . WRAPTEXT Comp sales were favorable across four of our five top markets , with the U.K. , WRAPTEXT driven by continued deflation in food and aggressive competition , being the WRAPTEXT exception . We also had negative comps in Japan , lapping last year ’ s benefit of WRAPTEXT accelerated consumer spending ahead of the April 2014 consumption tax hike . WRAPTEXT We grew comp sales in our remaining markets . WRAPTEXT As expected , operating income grew slower than sales at 0.1 percent on a WRAPTEXT constant currency basis , impacted by planned strategic investments in our e- WRAPTEXT commerce businesses and ongoing economic and competitive pressures in certain WRAPTEXT markets . With the currency exchange impact , operating income decreased 11.0 WRAPTEXT percent on a reported basis . WRAPTEXT On a constant currency basis , inventory grew faster than sales at 8.2 WRAPTEXT percent , driven by slower sales in the U.K. and inventory build-up leading up to the WRAPTEXT Easter holiday . On a reported basis , inventory declined 5.4 percent . WRAPTEXT Now let ’ s discuss individual results for our largest markets . Comp sales and WRAPTEXT changes in various metrics are presented on a constant currency basis only . In all WRAPTEXT countries except Brazil and China , financial results are inclusive of e-commerce . WRAPTEXT Slides 8 and 9 of the presentation summarize financial details . WRAPTEXT 15 WRAPTEXT Let ’ s start with the U.K . The market remained highly competitive and WRAPTEXT promotional . Hard discounters continued to gain share , though at a slowing rate , WRAPTEXT and all major supermarkets stepped up aggressive investments in price . As a WRAPTEXT result , grocery deflation persisted at record levels , leading to low market growth . WRAPTEXT Grocery prices were down 2.0 percent versus last year for the 12-weeks ended WRAPTEXT March 29 , according to Kantar . WRAPTEXT U.K. sales declined 2.9 percent and comp sales declined 3.3 percent , WRAPTEXT excluding fuel , primarily driven by deflation in fresh . Operating income declined , WRAPTEXT negatively impacted by lower sales and margin . Heading into Q2 , the team is WRAPTEXT focused on improving sales and operating performance through price investments WRAPTEXT in branded goods , maintaining aggressive price points on key items , and WRAPTEXT continuing to invest in the highest quality fresh offering . Asda ’ s five-year strategy WRAPTEXT of investing £1 billion in lowering prices remains on track this year , our second WRAPTEXT year of the program . WRAPTEXT In Canada , we maintained solid growth amid a dynamic , competitive WRAPTEXT environment . Sales were up 3.7 percent , and comps were up 1.8 percent , driven WRAPTEXT by solid Easter sales , strong performance in seasonal , and improving strength in WRAPTEXT our overall food business , including fresh . We continue to enhance our value and WRAPTEXT price offering , especially with private brands , where we saw significant growth . WRAPTEXT Market share increased in food , health and wellness , consumables , and infant WRAPTEXT categories , for the 12 weeks ended April 18 , according to Nielsen . WRAPTEXT Operating income grew faster than sales for the quarter . We remain focused WRAPTEXT on our low cost operating model and continue to seek out opportunities to drive WRAPTEXT efficiencies to reduce expenses . I ’ m pleased with performance overall and expect WRAPTEXT the positive trend to continue , as the competitive landscape evolves . WRAPTEXT On May 8 , we announced the acquisition of 13 stores – 12 leased and one WRAPTEXT owned – and one distribution center from a former competitor . While these WRAPTEXT transactions are subject to bankruptcy court approval , we look forward to bringing WRAPTEXT additional supercentres to more provinces in Canada . These stores are in addition WRAPTEXT to the 29 supercentres we announced as part of our current fiscal year expansion WRAPTEXT program . WRAPTEXT 16 WRAPTEXT Next , let ’ s turn to Mexico , which released their earnings on April 21 . Please WRAPTEXT note that the Walmex release is under IFRS and the results here are under U.S. WRAPTEXT GAAP , therefore some numbers may differ .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Rosalind Brewer WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club WRAPTEXT Thank you , Dave . WRAPTEXT Our second initiative is focused on membership and decision sciences . WRAPTEXT 20 WRAPTEXT Our fourth initiative is a significant long-term investment in our e-commerce WRAPTEXT business . WRAPTEXT For additional results with fuel , please reference the accompanying presentation . WRAPTEXT In Q1 , net sales , without fuel , grew 1.2 percent to $ 12.4 billion . Comp sales WRAPTEXT were 0.4 percent , driven by ticket increases of 60 basis points and by a traffic WRAPTEXT decline of 20 basis points . Savings member traffic was positive , offset by a WRAPTEXT decline in business member traffic . E-commerce contributed 40 basis points to the WRAPTEXT comp for the 13-week period . paragraph: WRAPTEXT Consolidated Walmex net sales increased 7.2 percent , with solid WRAPTEXT comp sales in both Mexico and Central America . Mexico sales grew 7.4 WRAPTEXT percent and comp sales increased 5.4 percent . We continue to see strong WRAPTEXT comps across all formats , including Sam ’ s Club , which delivered 4.6 WRAPTEXT percent comp growth . Self-service continues to gain share and delivered a WRAPTEXT 190 basis point improvement in market share , according to ANTAD . WRAPTEXT General merchandise performed very well at 4.9 percent comp growth , WRAPTEXT despite a tough year-over-year comparison from last year ’ s World Cup . WRAPTEXT Operating income grew faster than sales . WRAPTEXT The sale of our banking unit in the second quarter , along with the WRAPTEXT Vips restaurant divestiture last fiscal year , helps us focus on our core WRAPTEXT business , which is our strength . We are intent on being the most relevant WRAPTEXT retailer for our customers through excellent prices , great assortment and WRAPTEXT consistent execution . We remain confident that the steps we have in place WRAPTEXT to improve Walmex are working and will serve as a catalyst for our WRAPTEXT business over the long-term . WRAPTEXT In Canada , sales grew 5.4 percent and comps grew 3.9 percent in a WRAPTEXT low growth economic environment , driven by strong performance in food , WRAPTEXT health and wellness , home , and toys . We ’ re investing in price and value , WRAPTEXT as we look for opportunities to lower costs in our business . We continued to WRAPTEXT gain share in our core categories of food , health & wellness and infant WRAPTEXT categories , as per Nielsen data for the 12 weeks ended July 18th . WRAPTEXT Additionally , our Canadian e-commerce business grew sales at more than WRAPTEXT 40 percent , albeit on a small base . In July , we successfully launched our WRAPTEXT online grocery business , starting with 11 store pick-up locations in the WRAPTEXT Ottawa area . In addition to top line performance , we remain focused on our WRAPTEXT 23 WRAPTEXT low cost operating model . Operating income grew significantly faster than WRAPTEXT sales . WRAPTEXT In the quarter , we finalized the acquisition of 13 stores and one WRAPTEXT distribution center from a former competitor . Seven of the stores are WRAPTEXT planned to open by the end of this fiscal year and the remainder will open WRAPTEXT next year . In May , we also closed the sale of a portfolio of properties under WRAPTEXT development with our shopping center joint venture partner , which WRAPTEXT generated the previously mentioned gain . Overall , I ’ m pleased with our WRAPTEXT results in Canada and expect consistent , profitable growth to continue . WRAPTEXT In Brazil , the country is facing a prolonged recession and the highest WRAPTEXT inflation rate in 12 years , driven in part , by electricity rate increases of more WRAPTEXT than 50 percent versus last year , which is driving a cautious approach to WRAPTEXT consumption . For Walmart Brazil , net sales declined 0.9 percent and comp WRAPTEXT sales were down 1.0 percent , largely impacted by the World Cup event WRAPTEXT held during the same period last year and the timing of the Easter holiday . WRAPTEXT We experienced a decline in the hypermarket format , driven by electronics , WRAPTEXT but are pleased with the double-digit comp sales increases in the wholesale WRAPTEXT business . WRAPTEXT Brazil operating income declined for the quarter , driven by the WRAPTEXT previously mentioned employment claims and rapidly rising utility rates WRAPTEXT compared to last year . The management team is making progress on the WRAPTEXT operational , people , and legal fronts to address ongoing employment WRAPTEXT claims as they work through a challenging business environment . In WRAPTEXT addition , they are focused on key leverage initiatives to increase store WRAPTEXT productivity and help offset inflationary pressure . WRAPTEXT We continue to make progress on converting stores and distribution WRAPTEXT centers to standardized systems , which provides better visibility to business WRAPTEXT results , leverages costs , and reduces compliance risk . Last year , we WRAPTEXT integrated all of our stores in the South region . This year , we ’ re focused on WRAPTEXT converting the south dry DC network , as well as approximately 100 stores WRAPTEXT 24 WRAPTEXT in the northeast . Next year , we plan to convert the remaining northeast WRAPTEXT stores and dry DCs to this unified platform . WRAPTEXT Despite challenging market conditions , the e-commerce business in WRAPTEXT Brazil continues to perform well . Sales grew double digits and outpaced WRAPTEXT the Brazilian e-commerce market . Market share rose from 8.0 percent to WRAPTEXT 8.5 percent in Q2 , according to eBit , an e-commerce research firm , with WRAPTEXT share gains in several categories , including babies , toys and games , and WRAPTEXT auto parts . Marketplace sales growth was also strong . WRAPTEXT Last , let ’ s discuss China . Walmart China ’ s sales grew 1.2 percent , WRAPTEXT while comp sales declined 1.4 percent . Walmart increased market share in WRAPTEXT fast moving consumer goods in the hypermarket channel and maintained WRAPTEXT share in the modern trade channel , which includes smaller format stores , WRAPTEXT for the 12 weeks ended June 28 , according to Nielsen . WRAPTEXT While there are ongoing market headwinds from slower economic WRAPTEXT growth , we ’ re confident we ’ ll continue to deliver sustainable growth in WRAPTEXT China . Walmart continues to outperform the market and gained market WRAPTEXT share in hypermarkets for the 10th quarter in a row . We ’ re focused on WRAPTEXT driving efficiency , reducing expenses and strengthening our portfolio WRAPTEXT through ‘ We Operate for Less ’ and ‘ We Buy for Less ’ initiatives . These WRAPTEXT actions contributed to operating income growing significantly faster than WRAPTEXT sales . The team continues to set the foundation for our business , WRAPTEXT positioning it for increased growth and profitability in the future . WRAPTEXT Throughout the quarter , we made significant progress in our omni- WRAPTEXT channel efforts . Walmart China launched “ Walmart To Go ” in 23 stores in WRAPTEXT Shenzhen , bringing customers the convenience of ordering through the WRAPTEXT Walmart app and the choice of pick up in store or delivery to their home . WRAPTEXT We ’ re also testing ways to bring added payment choices and the WRAPTEXT convenience of mobile payment to our customers in our stores . WRAPTEXT In addition , as Doug and Neil mentioned , we increased our ownership WRAPTEXT of Yihaodian , our China e-commerce platform , to 100 percent . We ’ re WRAPTEXT 25 WRAPTEXT excited about the opportunities to deliver new experiences to customers in WRAPTEXT China and further leverage Yihaodian and Walmart ’ s global and local WRAPTEXT assets . In the second quarter , Yihaodian grew sales double digits , driven WRAPTEXT by strong growth in orders and continued improvement in conversion rates . WRAPTEXT Mobile contributed more than 55 percent of orders . WRAPTEXT As I wrap up the International portion of today ’ s call , I ’ d like to WRAPTEXT express how pleased I am with our associates around the globe and their WRAPTEXT efforts in driving consistent and solid performance in the first half . We ’ re WRAPTEXT growing comp sales across the majority of our portfolio and stepping up WRAPTEXT investments in e-commerce , while setting our business up for long-term WRAPTEXT success . WRAPTEXT We expect continued economic challenges in the U.K. and Brazil , but WRAPTEXT also expect continued strong performance in Mexico and Canada . We ’ re WRAPTEXT optimistic about our growth prospects in China despite a softening WRAPTEXT economy and will continue to invest in that market . WRAPTEXT Now , I ’ ll turn it over to Roz for an update on Sam ’ s . Roz…

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Rosalind Brewer WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club WRAPTEXT Thanks , Dave . WRAPTEXT We were pleased that our investments are contributing to the WRAPTEXT improvements in Sam ’ s Club . In the second quarter , we grew comp sales , WRAPTEXT without fuel , 1.3 percent and net sales 2.8 percent . Our square footage WRAPTEXT also grew due to 3 new clubs openings during the quarter . We are WRAPTEXT accelerating our efforts to strengthen the Sam ’ s Club member value WRAPTEXT proposition . WRAPTEXT Since last year , our investments have been targeted to better WRAPTEXT merchandise assortment , membership acquisition , engagement and WRAPTEXT 26 WRAPTEXT retention , new programs to enhance member value , and our investment in WRAPTEXT e-commerce . By staying on a consistent path and driving these priorities , WRAPTEXT we continue to simplify our business . We saw the benefits in improved WRAPTEXT membership trends and higher traffic during the second quarter . What is WRAPTEXT most important is the overwhelmingly positive feedback we ’ re hearing from WRAPTEXT our members , not just about our clubs , but also about improvement in the WRAPTEXT e-commerce experience . I ’ ll provide some examples shortly . WRAPTEXT Now , on to the numbers… With fuel , operating income declined by WRAPTEXT 13.4 percent to $ 428 million . Fuel profitability improved from Q1 , but is still WRAPTEXT below planned levels and below last year ’ s dollars . For additional results WRAPTEXT with fuel , please reference the accompanying presentation . WRAPTEXT Net sales , without fuel , grew 2.8 percent . Comp sales without fuel , WRAPTEXT were up 1.3 percent , with ticket contributing 80 basis points and traffic 50 WRAPTEXT basis points . Savings member traffic was positive , partially offset by a WRAPTEXT decline in business member traffic . WRAPTEXT Our gross profit rate declined 38 basis points versus last year , driven WRAPTEXT in part by our ongoing cash rewards investment , increased seasonal WRAPTEXT markdowns and industry headwinds in pharmacy prescriptions similar to WRAPTEXT those referenced in the Walmart U.S. business . WRAPTEXT Operating expenses as a percentage of net sales increased by 13 WRAPTEXT basis points , due to continued investments in new clubs , technology and e- WRAPTEXT commerce . Membership and other income grew 6.1 percent , with WRAPTEXT membership income up 5.8 percent , driven in large part by Plus upgrades . WRAPTEXT As a result of both of these factors , operating income declined 9.7 percent WRAPTEXT versus last year . WRAPTEXT We continue to manage our inventory appropriately . Inventory , WRAPTEXT without fuel , grew by 3.4 percent , driven in part by new clubs . WRAPTEXT 27 WRAPTEXT In our merchandising areas , let me start by highlighting two of our WRAPTEXT stronger categories -- home and apparel and health and wellness . WRAPTEXT Home and apparel delivered low single-digit comp sales , with WRAPTEXT strength in apparel , offset by softness in kitchen electrics , domestics and WRAPTEXT furniture . WRAPTEXT Health and wellness posted mid single-digit comps , driven by WRAPTEXT generics and by increased member adoption of our Free/4/10 prescription WRAPTEXT program . Since the launch of this program last quarter for Plus members , WRAPTEXT we see that those who utilize the program transfer on average two-thirds of WRAPTEXT their scripts to Sam ’ s Club . We are optimistic that these trends will WRAPTEXT continue to drive traffic . WRAPTEXT Our fresh/freezer/cooler business was softer than expected , due to WRAPTEXT deflation in key dairy commodities such as milk and cheese , along with WRAPTEXT higher costs in areas such as meat . WRAPTEXT Grocery and beverages delivered low single-digit comps , with dry WRAPTEXT grocery delivering solid comp sales . WRAPTEXT The consumables business also delivered low single-digit comps , WRAPTEXT driven by laundry and tabletop categories . WRAPTEXT Our technology , entertainment , and office businesses , albeit posting WRAPTEXT negative comps , saw improvement from Q1 levels . We saw acceleration in WRAPTEXT certain key categories such as tablets . That was offset in part by our WRAPTEXT wireless business , which has been negatively impacted by the industry shift WRAPTEXT to installment plans . WRAPTEXT We continue to make progress in e-commerce to build the most WRAPTEXT convenient club in the industry . We ’ re pleased with our ongoing integration WRAPTEXT of digital and physical . E-commerce contributed approximately 60 basis WRAPTEXT points to our club comp performance during the period , and traffic to our WRAPTEXT site was up just over 20 percent . We delivered new club pick-up options WRAPTEXT 28 WRAPTEXT that make it easier and more convenient for members to shop online and WRAPTEXT pick up at the club . Pre-paid club pick-up rolled out across the country , and WRAPTEXT we started testing mobile check-in and drive-through in several clubs . The WRAPTEXT number of members trying it for the first time during the quarter exceeded WRAPTEXT our expectations , and we expect ongoing acceptance of this service . WRAPTEXT We have also improved the assortment and pricing online . Knowing WRAPTEXT that members love the treasure hunt , we launched “ Shocking Values ” that WRAPTEXT give members access to special items at outstanding prices for a very WRAPTEXT limited time . Shocking Values products are carefully chosen based on WRAPTEXT members ’ interests , top trends and items from the company ’ s most popular WRAPTEXT shopping categories . In addition , our enhancements to mobile have also WRAPTEXT built on our member experience and drove double-digit growth in traffic . WRAPTEXT Membership income was up versus last year , with growth driven by WRAPTEXT social media campaigns , as well as strong Plus renewals and upgrades , WRAPTEXT due to the benefits of cash rewards . We also continue to emphasize our WRAPTEXT award winning Sam ’ s Club 5-3-1 MasterCard , which allows members to WRAPTEXT save inside and outside the club . We ’ ve received very positive feedback WRAPTEXT from our members on this program . WRAPTEXT We recently hosted our annual supplier summit here in Bentonville , WRAPTEXT and we were pleased with the excellent attendance and engagement . Our WRAPTEXT suppliers are very interested in the work we ’ ve done to ensure their great WRAPTEXT items are getting in front of our member base . They are supportive of the WRAPTEXT innovation and merchandising transformation we have in place . We have WRAPTEXT great items coming for the holidays . WRAPTEXT We are focused on further progress in the Sam ’ s Club business for WRAPTEXT the back half of the year . For the 13-week period ending October 30 , 2015 WRAPTEXT we expect comp sales , without fuel , to be between flat and up 2 percent . WRAPTEXT Now , I ’ ll turn things over to Charles . Charles… WRAPTEXT 29

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Greg Foran - Wal-Mart Stores , Inc. - President & CEO , Walmart US WRAPTEXT As Charles and Doug have said , we have given the guidance . I am not going to do anything other than say I am pleased with the momentum we WRAPTEXT are seeing in the business . Doug mentioned general merchandise previously , food I am also feeling better about . We are seeing more traffic so we WRAPTEXT have got more customers visiting our stores . WRAPTEXT We are seeing an improvement in units , they are trending north . And I know that we can build on the momentum that we have got ( technical WRAPTEXT difficulty ) . 3 % to 4 % total sales CAGR is what I and my team have signed up for and we know that we can do that .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Doug McMillon WRAPTEXT President and CEO WRAPTEXT Thanks , Pauline , and good morning everyone . WRAPTEXT Thank you for joining us to hear more about our third quarter WRAPTEXT earnings , as well as the strategy we shared at our annual meeting for the WRAPTEXT investment community last month . WRAPTEXT Overall , we had a good quarter . We delivered earnings per share WRAPTEXT well within our guidance range , recorded our fifth straight quarter of positive WRAPTEXT comps at Walmart U.S. , and had solid international sales and profit growth WRAPTEXT on a constant currency basis . At the same time , we still have plenty of WRAPTEXT work to do , and there are areas of our business that must perform better . WRAPTEXT Our earnings per share were $ 1.03 , and we posted total revenue of WRAPTEXT $ 117.4 billion . I want to highlight that , on a constant currency basis our WRAPTEXT total revenue would have been $ 122.4 billion . That ’ s growth of $ 3.4 billion WRAPTEXT or 2.8 percent on a constant currency basis , which is solid growth . Even if WRAPTEXT the percentage does n't sound high because we have such a large WRAPTEXT denominator , not many companies grow by this amount in a quarter . I call WRAPTEXT this out because I don ’ t want the currency impacts to obscure the strength WRAPTEXT of our business . We are a growth company - and we ’ re growing . WRAPTEXT As we expected , operating income continued to be pressured by our WRAPTEXT decision to invest in our front line associates . To improve the store WRAPTEXT experience for our customers and create a bridge to our future where digital WRAPTEXT capabilities will play an increasing role in our stores , we ’ re making a $ 1.2 WRAPTEXT billion planned investment in our people this year that we understood would WRAPTEXT impact near-term operating income . This is by far the biggest driver of the WRAPTEXT decline in consolidated operating income . WRAPTEXT 4 WRAPTEXT Before going into the details , I want to take a step back to talk about WRAPTEXT our strategy . At our investor meeting last month , we shared more detail WRAPTEXT than usual about the next three years of our growth plan . We ’ ve never WRAPTEXT been a company that manages only for the short term , and that ’ s certainly WRAPTEXT true during this period of change . Although investments in our people and WRAPTEXT technology impact near term earnings , they will help us deliver sustainable WRAPTEXT growth and returns to shareholders over time . WRAPTEXT We ’ re confident these are the right steps because we know where WRAPTEXT and how we ’ re going to win . We will be the first to deliver a seamless WRAPTEXT shopping experience at scale . No matter how you choose to shop with us - WRAPTEXT through your mobile device , online , in a store or a combination - it will be WRAPTEXT fast and easy . Online retailers are testing physical store experiences WRAPTEXT because they recognize the same customer desire that we do . There ’ s a WRAPTEXT race to do this right , but only Walmart can bring together a dense network WRAPTEXT of stores , supported by a supply chain and systems like ours , with an WRAPTEXT emerging set of digital capabilities to win with customers . WRAPTEXT As we create this seamless experience , we ’ re positioning for growth WRAPTEXT in five key areas : WRAPTEXT • First , we ’ ll continue to win on value . We ’ ve won on value in the WRAPTEXT past and that won ’ t change . WRAPTEXT • Second , convenience is increasingly important as customers want WRAPTEXT to save both money and time . WRAPTEXT • Third , we will always work to be great merchants - whether in WRAPTEXT stores or online . WRAPTEXT • Fourth , we ’ re focused on the key geographies for customer WRAPTEXT growth , which are North America and China . WRAPTEXT • Finally , we want to appeal to a blend of income levels . The way WRAPTEXT we ’ re approaching e-commerce , Neighborhood Markets , Sam 's WRAPTEXT Club , grocery pickup , and other areas will appeal to value- WRAPTEXT conscious customers of all demographics . We already serve WRAPTEXT customers from all income levels around the world but we have an WRAPTEXT opportunity to get even stronger . WRAPTEXT 5 WRAPTEXT By taking these steps , we will grow the company faster . We will add WRAPTEXT between $ 45 - 60 billion dollars of revenue to the company in the next three WRAPTEXT years . That ’ s a lot of growth ; it just happens to be on a big base . WRAPTEXT Returning to this quarter ’ s results , one of the most important WRAPTEXT takeaways is that our U.S. stores continue to improve , with total net sales WRAPTEXT up nearly 4 percent . In addition to positive comp sales , Walmart U.S. had WRAPTEXT its fourth straight quarter of positive traffic . We ’ re now lapping positive WRAPTEXT comp sales and building on our progress . Our customers are telling us that WRAPTEXT our efforts around clean , fast and friendly are resonating . Neighborhood WRAPTEXT Markets continued to show strong sales , led by our newer stores , and have WRAPTEXT posted positive comps for 19 consecutive quarters . A key part of creating a WRAPTEXT seamless shopping experience is to have great stores , and we feel good WRAPTEXT about where we ’ re heading . WRAPTEXT We also made strides in the U.S. on adding critical capabilities to our WRAPTEXT supply chain . In the third quarter , we opened a new e-commerce fulfillment WRAPTEXT center in Atlanta with more than one million square feet of space . This is WRAPTEXT our fifth next-generation fulfillment center . WRAPTEXT As we build out our e-commerce capabilities , we are deepening our WRAPTEXT digital relationships with our customers . We ’ ve accelerated our expansion WRAPTEXT of online grocery pickup , and we ’ ve seen that customers who start using WRAPTEXT online grocery spend nearly 50 percent more than similar customers who WRAPTEXT shop only in stores . This is the customer we ’ re going after - the shopper in WRAPTEXT our “ sweet spot ” who accesses Walmart in multiple ways . WRAPTEXT We also began the chain-wide use of a mobile service that can tell us WRAPTEXT when a customer is coming to pick up an online general merchandise order WRAPTEXT - before they even walk into the store - and we launched a new digital wish WRAPTEXT list that you can build at home or simply by scanning items in a store . We WRAPTEXT expect more than 210 million visits to our app in November and December WRAPTEXT - up from 18 million in 2012 . WRAPTEXT 6 WRAPTEXT Last month , we told you about our longer-term plans to grow e- WRAPTEXT commerce sales and GMV . That plan anticipates ebbs and flows along the WRAPTEXT way , but we are confident in our targets . We continue to expect to grow WRAPTEXT mid-to-high teens for this fiscal year . During the third quarter , Global WRAPTEXT eCommerce sales and GMV growth both came in at around 10 percent . WRAPTEXT This was due primarily to continued economic challenges in our major WRAPTEXT international markets , including Brazil , China and the UK . In the U.S. WRAPTEXT where we have seen good growth for the year , we continue to make WRAPTEXT progress on key initiatives , but we know we have more work to do . I was WRAPTEXT pleased that Samsclub.com continued to deliver strong growth . WRAPTEXT In Walmart International , we ’ re pleased with the solid 3.2 percent WRAPTEXT sales growth on a constant currency basis . Operating income grew faster WRAPTEXT than sales at 8.5 percent , excluding currency . Our North American markets WRAPTEXT delivered strong performance , and Mexico in particular is starting to fire on WRAPTEXT all cylinders . I ’ m pleased with our momentum in these markets . We WRAPTEXT continue to face specific challenges in the U.K. and Brazil . WRAPTEXT China remains a huge long term opportunity . We started in China in WRAPTEXT 1996 . We ’ ve grown the business , reached profitability years ago and WRAPTEXT grown our level of profitability . We obviously learned a lot about Chinese WRAPTEXT customers and the market and that ’ s an asset . A few weeks ago , I was WRAPTEXT back in Beijing and Shanghai walking stores , clubs and visiting our e- WRAPTEXT commerce offices . We now have a total of 12 Sam ’ s Clubs open and WRAPTEXT they ’ re performing very well . Our stores have clearly improved WRAPTEXT operationally in recent years , in particular , and now they ’ re supported by a WRAPTEXT supply chain that positions us to win . We see that e-commerce , online WRAPTEXT grocery and convenience are critical in the dense urban areas that make up WRAPTEXT so much of the Chinese opportunity . That ’ s why our Yihaodian acquisition WRAPTEXT is of such strategic significance . We also recommitted to our work on food WRAPTEXT safety , environmental sustainability , and empowering women during my WRAPTEXT visit , announcing another investment in the China Women ’ s Development WRAPTEXT Foundation . With the improvements we ’ ve made to our stores and clubs WRAPTEXT and the full acquisition of Yihaodian , we have a unique opportunity and a WRAPTEXT plan to put it all together to win in China . WRAPTEXT 7 WRAPTEXT While positive , our U.S. Sam ’ s Club comp sales , without fuel , were at WRAPTEXT the low end of our guidance . We were pleased with the growth in WRAPTEXT membership income , but we can do better with our overall results . Sam ’ s WRAPTEXT Club did take important steps this quarter to deepen digital relationships WRAPTEXT with our members through Club Pickup , expanded mobile check-in WRAPTEXT capabilities , and extended drive-thru or curbside options . Roz will share WRAPTEXT more about our strategy going forward in a moment . WRAPTEXT In addition to releasing earnings , today is a big day around our Home WRAPTEXT Office . We are holding a Sustainability Milestone Meeting to celebrate ten WRAPTEXT years of progress on sustainability since our then-CEO Lee Scott delivered WRAPTEXT a landmark speech titled “ 21st Century Leadership. ” In those remarks , Lee WRAPTEXT laid out three big goals for Walmart - to be powered by 100 percent WRAPTEXT renewable energy , to create zero waste , and to sell products that sustain WRAPTEXT people and the environment . It was a defining moment for our company . WRAPTEXT By looking through the lens of sustainability , Lee realized we could think WRAPTEXT about problems in creative ways , make our business more efficient , and WRAPTEXT bring renewed passion to our work . It was and is inspiring to be a part of WRAPTEXT this journey . WRAPTEXT Today , we ’ ll mark how far we ’ ve come and what we ’ ve achieved . For WRAPTEXT example , the savings we ’ ve generated from reducing waste , running our WRAPTEXT truck fleet more efficiently , and pursuing energy efficiency has been good WRAPTEXT for society and good for our shareholders . We ’ re getting excited to take the WRAPTEXT next steps in this journey early next year . In true Walmart fashion , we ’ re WRAPTEXT looking at ways to make a difference in the world , serve our stakeholders , WRAPTEXT and drive our bottom line . WRAPTEXT Let me reiterate that we are excited about the unique opportunity we WRAPTEXT have to create a seamless shopping experience for our customers and WRAPTEXT ensure sustainable growth for the business . We ’ re making critical WRAPTEXT investments to better serve our customers , associates , and shareholders , WRAPTEXT and we are on the right path . WRAPTEXT 8 WRAPTEXT As I close , I want to pause to thank Charles Holley for his years of WRAPTEXT outstanding service to Walmart . As you know , he has made the decision to WRAPTEXT retire . He 's been a huge asset to the company and a great partner to me WRAPTEXT and the leadership team . This is his last earnings call , and he will be WRAPTEXT missed . Thank you , Charles . WRAPTEXT Now , I ’ ll turn it over to Claire . Claire…

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Walmart International CEO WRAPTEXT Thanks , Greg . WRAPTEXT We had a solid quarter with sales growth accelerating slightly from WRAPTEXT last quarter and operating income growing faster than sales , both on a WRAPTEXT constant currency basis . Comp trends in Mexico and Canada continued to WRAPTEXT be strong , which more than offset weaker sales performances in the U.K. , WRAPTEXT Brazil , and China , where we continue to experience various competitive WRAPTEXT and economic challenges . WRAPTEXT Our markets remain focused on the strategic priorities discussed WRAPTEXT earlier this year , which include : WRAPTEXT • Actively managing the existing portfolio WRAPTEXT • Delivering balanced growth , including e-commerce WRAPTEXT • Being the lowest cost operator WRAPTEXT • And , building solid foundations , in terms of talent , trust , and WRAPTEXT technology WRAPTEXT Let me touch on some of the progress we ’ ve made . WRAPTEXT We ’ ve continued to take action this year to drive simplicity and focus WRAPTEXT in our portfolio . We sold a portfolio of properties under development with WRAPTEXT our shopping center joint venture partner in Canada and exited our bank WRAPTEXT operations in Mexico . We ’ re currently pursuing the sale of a portfolio of WRAPTEXT shopping centers in Chile and we ’ re closing our business-to-business sales WRAPTEXT operations in the U.K. At the same time , we ’ ve looked for ways to enhance WRAPTEXT our portfolio in core markets , which we ’ ve done by taking full ownership of WRAPTEXT Yihaodian in China and acquiring 13 stores and one DC from a former WRAPTEXT 16 WRAPTEXT competitor in Canada . We ’ ll continue to review our portfolio to simplify our WRAPTEXT operations and help our teams stay focused on running great businesses . WRAPTEXT Our markets continue to invest heavily in price , quality , and service , WRAPTEXT aimed at driving comp sales . Our overall trend is improving , as seven of WRAPTEXT our 11 markets have now delivered positive comps for six straight quarters . WRAPTEXT We ’ re delivering value and providing convenience that is attracting WRAPTEXT customers to our stores , clubs , websites , and apps across our markets . WRAPTEXT I ’ m pleased with the innovation we ’ re driving in e-commerce , led by WRAPTEXT online grocery , and I ’ m excited about the potential we have to access a WRAPTEXT broader customer segment . We continue to learn from our online grocery WRAPTEXT business in the U.K. , as we test and roll out similar initiatives in Mexico and WRAPTEXT Canada and build a strong platform for growth in China . As Doug WRAPTEXT mentioned , the continued economic challenges in some of our major WRAPTEXT markets impacted our overall global e-commerce sales growth this quarter . WRAPTEXT We still have work to do , but I ’ m confident we ’ re executing against this key WRAPTEXT strategic priority . WRAPTEXT Now , let ’ s discuss our overall results . In the third quarter , net sales WRAPTEXT grew 3.2 percent on a constant currency basis . Reported net sales WRAPTEXT declined 11.4 percent , impacted by an approximately $ 5.0 billion currency WRAPTEXT impact from the continued strength of the U.S. dollar . Fluctuations in WRAPTEXT currency exchange rates continue to negatively impact our reported results , WRAPTEXT so it ’ s important to emphasize that our business , on a constant currency WRAPTEXT basis , is maintaining steady growth . WRAPTEXT We had strong positive comp sales in Mexico and Canada . The U.K. , WRAPTEXT Brazil , and China posted negative comps , although the comps were slightly WRAPTEXT better in Q3 versus Q2 . In each of our other markets , we had solid comps WRAPTEXT of at least three percent . WRAPTEXT Operating income grew faster than net sales at 8.5 percent on a WRAPTEXT constant currency basis , driven in large part by excellent performance in WRAPTEXT Mexico and Canada . In addition , as Claire mentioned earlier , there was an WRAPTEXT 17 WRAPTEXT immaterial lease accounting adjustment this quarter , which favorably WRAPTEXT impacted operating expenses by approximately $ 49 million on a constant WRAPTEXT currency basis . With the currency exchange impact , operating income WRAPTEXT decreased 6.4 percent . WRAPTEXT On a constant currency basis , inventory grew faster than net sales at WRAPTEXT 7.0 percent , primarily driven by our decision in Mexico to flow inventory WRAPTEXT through our import network early for the upcoming holiday season . On a WRAPTEXT reported basis , inventory declined 10.0 percent . WRAPTEXT Now let ’ s discuss market results , presented on a constant currency WRAPTEXT basis , for our largest markets . In all countries except Brazil and China , WRAPTEXT financial results are inclusive of e-commerce . WRAPTEXT Let ’ s begin with the U.K . Challenging competitive conditions WRAPTEXT persisted throughout the quarter as the market continues to experience WRAPTEXT rapid structural change . Customers have now benefitted from more than WRAPTEXT 12 months of continually falling prices and the market has grown by less WRAPTEXT than one percent for six consecutive months , despite a healthier overall WRAPTEXT economy , according to Kantar . The big four grocers continue to lose share WRAPTEXT to the discounters . WRAPTEXT U.K. net sales declined by 3.2 percent and comp sales , excluding WRAPTEXT fuel , were down 4.6 percent . Large store traffic and food remain the WRAPTEXT primary challenges , while online grocery continues to grow . The online WRAPTEXT business is focused on improving its core service offering and is performing WRAPTEXT above target on key internal performance metrics . Operating income WRAPTEXT increased , driven by reduced expenses , as well as lapping some WRAPTEXT organizational restructuring costs from last year . WRAPTEXT The U.K. is focused on rebuilding momentum in its core business . WRAPTEXT Last month , we launched Project Renewal , an 18-month project that WRAPTEXT reaffirms the direction set out in the five-year strategy , but prioritizes WRAPTEXT investments more clearly on price , quality and service in large stores , while WRAPTEXT putting non-core expansion , such as remote petrol stations , on hold . WRAPTEXT 18 WRAPTEXT Greater focus on driving out inefficiencies across both buying and WRAPTEXT operations will enable the U.K. to build on its well-established value WRAPTEXT credentials and strengthen its competitive position . WRAPTEXT Let ’ s now discuss Mexico , which released their earnings on October WRAPTEXT 27 . Please note the Walmex release is under IFRS and the results here WRAPTEXT are under U.S. GAAP , therefore some numbers may differ .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Consolidated Walmex net sales increased 7.4 percent , with strong WRAPTEXT comp sales in both Mexico and Central America . Mexico sales grew 7.6 WRAPTEXT percent and comp sales increased 6.3 percent , driven by solid comp WRAPTEXT growth in both self-service and Sam ’ s Club . In self-service , we achieved WRAPTEXT mid-single digit growth in groceries and high-single digit growth in GM and WRAPTEXT apparel . Self-service continues to gain share and delivered a 220 basis WRAPTEXT point improvement in market share , according to ANTAD . Sam ’ s Club is WRAPTEXT maintaining its steady improvement in comps , aided by ongoing events and WRAPTEXT campaigns to drive traffic and grow membership . We leveraged expenses WRAPTEXT in the quarter and grew operating income significantly faster than sales . WRAPTEXT Our e-commerce business in Mexico is growing in line with the WRAPTEXT market , driven by strong growth in general merchandise . Under the WRAPTEXT Walmart banner , we ’ re significantly expanding our assortment of ship-from- WRAPTEXT store items . We ’ re rapidly growing store coverage for online grocery and WRAPTEXT customer orders are increasing . At Sam ’ s Club , we ’ ve soft launched our WRAPTEXT new website , while maintaining healthy growth with our existing platform . WRAPTEXT In Canada , we continue to maintain solid growth and gain share in a WRAPTEXT competitive and low-growth environment . Net sales grew 5.7 percent and WRAPTEXT comps were up 4.3 percent , driven by strong performance in our core WRAPTEXT grocery business , as well as stronger performance in our GM business . In WRAPTEXT the quarter , Canada saw share gains in food , health & wellness , WRAPTEXT consumables , and infants , for the 12 weeks ended October 29 , according WRAPTEXT to Nielsen . In addition to strong top line performance , the team continues WRAPTEXT to focus on our low cost operating model to drive a sustainable price WRAPTEXT advantage . Canada grew operating income faster than sales . WRAPTEXT 19 WRAPTEXT We continue to invest in expanding customer access . We recently WRAPTEXT began a partnership with 7-Eleven and are piloting Grab & Go lockers at WRAPTEXT some of their convenience stores in the greater Toronto area . We are WRAPTEXT pleased with the progress that our online grocery business has made since WRAPTEXT our pilot launched in July . Overall , I ’ m pleased with our results in Canada , WRAPTEXT and I expect reliable growth to continue . WRAPTEXT In Brazil , the economic challenges are largely unchanged as high WRAPTEXT inflation and unemployment continue to impact consumer confidence and WRAPTEXT consumption levels . Net sales were down 0.4 percent and comps were WRAPTEXT down 0.6 percent , driven by a decline in the hypermarket format , mostly WRAPTEXT offset by strong sales growth in our wholesale business . General WRAPTEXT merchandise , primarily electronics , accounted for the largest portion of the WRAPTEXT hypermarket sales decline . These economic challenges are impacting both WRAPTEXT our store and e-commerce sales . WRAPTEXT Operating income declined faster than sales , due to increased labor WRAPTEXT claims , continued high utility costs , and higher markdown activity , which WRAPTEXT helped us improve our inventory position going into the fourth quarter . WRAPTEXT Let ’ s now shift to China , a key growth market . This quarter , sales WRAPTEXT grew 2.9 percent , driven by new store openings . Comp sales declined 0.7 WRAPTEXT percent amid slower consumption growth . In the Hypermarket channel , we WRAPTEXT gained share for an 11th consecutive quarter . We ’ ll continue to invest in WRAPTEXT physical and digital to deliver a seamless shopping experience . WRAPTEXT We continue to drive efficiency in stores and at the home office . WRAPTEXT Operating income grew faster than net sales . ‘ We Operate for Less ’ WRAPTEXT productivity initiatives remain a focus , allowing reinvestment in labor and WRAPTEXT customer experience , particularly in fresh . WRAPTEXT Yihaodian , our e-commerce business in China , is focused on further WRAPTEXT leveraging Walmart ’ s global and local assets . The business improved WRAPTEXT margins and balanced marketing spend , amid intense competition on price . WRAPTEXT 20 WRAPTEXT While I 'm not satisfied with recent results , I ’ m confident in the actions we ’ re WRAPTEXT taking in China that position us to achieve success for many years to come . WRAPTEXT Now , let me recap . We had a good quarter with solid sales WRAPTEXT momentum in our underlying business , driven by healthy comp sales in a WRAPTEXT majority of our markets . In addition , we delivered a relatively high level of WRAPTEXT constant currency operating profit . Our strategy remains focused and our WRAPTEXT priorities are clear and we ’ re well positioned for future growth . WRAPTEXT Now , I ’ ll turn it over to Roz for the update on Sam ’ s . Roz…

Our International business is WRAPTEXT healthy and growing . WRAPTEXT Global eCommerce sales and Gross Merchandise Value ( GMV ) WRAPTEXT globally grew approximately 8 % in the fourth quarter . For the year , sales WRAPTEXT grew 12 % and GMV grew 13 % . The holiday season gave a good preview WRAPTEXT of how all the pieces we ’ re putting in place will come together . paragraph: WRAPTEXT Cyber Monday , and nearly half of our customers bought their online orders WRAPTEXT on a mobile device . We also saw growth in store pickup and online grocery . WRAPTEXT We have faced specific challenges in our largest e-commerce markets WRAPTEXT outside the U.S. Economic softness in Brazil and China continued to weigh WRAPTEXT on growth , and we have been in a transition phase at Yihaodian since WRAPTEXT acquiring full ownership . As mentioned before , the environment in the U.K. WRAPTEXT remains extremely competitive and it ’ s important to remember our e- WRAPTEXT commerce business in the U.K. is a food delivery and pick up business . In WRAPTEXT the U.S. , we plan to build on the foundation we ’ ve built by delivering a WRAPTEXT significant assortment expansion and faster delivery at a lower cost this WRAPTEXT year . We need more GMV growth from our e-commerce businesses . WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club is in the early days with its new strategy . Comps for the WRAPTEXT quarter were below what we anticipated , and food in particular WRAPTEXT underperformed outside of the holiday periods . We ’ re pleased with the WRAPTEXT 7 WRAPTEXT work so far to address the fundamentals of the business - to improve WRAPTEXT merchandising and drive new membership - but we have more to do . There WRAPTEXT are encouraging signs in our membership numbers . WRAPTEXT As we address issues with the core business , we ’ re excited by growth in WRAPTEXT new areas . For example , Club Pickup continued to be the fastest growing WRAPTEXT part of the business . WRAPTEXT Finally , even as we focus on our customers and our associates , we WRAPTEXT were reminded a few weeks ago about the opportunity we have to lead in WRAPTEXT our communities . Walmart , Coca-Cola , Nestle , and Pepsico announced we WRAPTEXT will collectively donate water to meet the daily needs of over 10,000 school WRAPTEXT children in Flint , Michigan for the balance of the calendar year . Whether it ’ s WRAPTEXT hiring veterans , supporting U.S. manufacturing , or driving new renewable WRAPTEXT energy production , we have strengths that can help others in important WRAPTEXT ways . During the first quarter , we will release our annual global WRAPTEXT responsibility report , alongside our annual report , to share more on how WRAPTEXT we ’ re making a difference . Leading on social and environmental issues is WRAPTEXT good for our business , for our shareholders , and for the world , and we will WRAPTEXT continue to move the needle this year . WRAPTEXT In summary , we continue to believe we are putting the right WRAPTEXT foundation in place to better serve customers , deliver stronger sales growth WRAPTEXT and ultimately strengthen bottom line performance . As we begin this new WRAPTEXT year , I ’ m focused on continuing the momentum in our U.S. stores , getting WRAPTEXT all the ingredients in place for stronger growth in e-commerce and the WRAPTEXT strategic choices related to how we put them together . I ’ m also mindful of WRAPTEXT the need for balance . Improving productivity , as we grow , is important . WRAPTEXT Brett will talk through our full-year forecast with the first quarter being the WRAPTEXT most pressured from an earnings point of view due to the timing of the WRAPTEXT incremental wage investments .
