Constant currency WRAPTEXT revenue grew 2.7 percent to $ 120.7 billion , comp sales were positive WRAPTEXT across each of our three operating segments , and Walmart U.S. WRAPTEXT eCommerce sales increased 33 percent . I ’ m pleased with the momentum WRAPTEXT we have in the business and the pace at which we ’ re moving to stay at the WRAPTEXT leading edge of retail . WRAPTEXT Over the past weeks , we have announced a couple of significant WRAPTEXT portfolio moves in the U.K. and in India . The ability to confidently make WRAPTEXT these decisions is due in large part to our very strong financial position as WRAPTEXT well as the business continuing to operate very well on a day to day basis . WRAPTEXT We continue to be pleased with the overall health and momentum of the WRAPTEXT various parts of our business worldwide . WRAPTEXT Now , I ’ ll provide additional details about our results from a WRAPTEXT consolidated perspective before moving on to our operating segments , WRAPTEXT including eCommerce .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Walmart U.S. WRAPTEXT The team delivered another quarter of solid top-line growth as comp WRAPTEXT sales , excluding fuel , increased 2.1 percent with a contribution from WRAPTEXT eCommerce of approximately 100 basis points . Our comp was trending WRAPTEXT higher through early April , but general merchandise sales and traffic were WRAPTEXT somewhat negatively impacted by cool weather in April . This business has WRAPTEXT picked up again as the weather has normalized . WRAPTEXT The grocery business continued its strong performance with healthy WRAPTEXT traffic across key categories . Strength in fresh food and packaged goods WRAPTEXT drove low single-digit comp sales for the quarter . WRAPTEXT Gross margin rate declined 23 basis points primarily due to price WRAPTEXT investments and higher transportation expenses as a result of higher fuel WRAPTEXT costs and third-party transportation rate pressures . WRAPTEXT Operating expenses deleveraged approximately 11 basis points WRAPTEXT largely due to investments in eCommerce and technology . Our stores WRAPTEXT leveraged expenses again this quarter as productivity improvements more WRAPTEXT than offset the impacts of increased associate wages . WRAPTEXT Overall , we ’ re pleased with the underlying strength in the Walmart WRAPTEXT U.S. business . We ’ re finding new ways to leverage our stores to provide WRAPTEXT even more convenience through the expansion of pickup towers as well as WRAPTEXT online grocery pickup and delivery . We ’ re saving customers time and WRAPTEXT money , and they ’ re responding favorably .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Walmart International WRAPTEXT We continue to execute against our strategic priorities of delivering WRAPTEXT disciplined growth and being a low cost operator . We ’ re being thoughtful WRAPTEXT and deliberate as we assess our portfolio and make decisions about where WRAPTEXT and how we ’ ll grow . We ’ re continually reviewing our portfolio and WRAPTEXT 8 WRAPTEXT consistent with that , we ’ re currently considering options for our business in WRAPTEXT Brazil . WRAPTEXT During the quarter , we saw broad-based sales growth across the WRAPTEXT markets with most of the growth coming from comp sales . Overall , eight of WRAPTEXT eleven markets delivered positive comps . We ’ re pleased with the trends WRAPTEXT we ’ re seeing in key areas such as fresh and private brands , as well as WRAPTEXT online grocery . We have good momentum in the business , and we ’ re well WRAPTEXT positioned for continued success . WRAPTEXT Net sales in constant currency increased 4.5 percent and grew 11.7 WRAPTEXT percent on a reported basis . Changes in currency rates benefited net sales WRAPTEXT by approximately $ 2 billion . While the earlier timing of Easter this year WRAPTEXT helped pull sales forward into the first quarter in a few markets , it ’ s WRAPTEXT important to note that we also experienced headwinds of about $ 200 million WRAPTEXT related to last year ’ s divestiture of Suburbia and the wind-down of the first WRAPTEXT party portion of our Brazil eCommerce business . WRAPTEXT From a profitability standpoint , first quarter operating income WRAPTEXT increased 0.2 percent in constant currency and 11.1 percent on a reported WRAPTEXT basis . Profit was negatively impacted by residual expenses related to the WRAPTEXT wind-down of eCommerce in Brazil and a charge related to the pending WRAPTEXT sale of our bank in Canada . These expenses were somewhat offset by a WRAPTEXT gain of $ 51 million for the sale of land in Canada . As a reminder , during WRAPTEXT the first quarter of last year , we recorded a gain in international of $ 47 WRAPTEXT million for the sale of land . Excluding all of these items , operating income WRAPTEXT growth in constant currency would have increased faster than sales growth . WRAPTEXT Let ’ s now turn to highlights from key markets . The following results WRAPTEXT for the quarter are on a constant currency basis . WRAPTEXT Momentum at Walmex continued across all countries and regions . WRAPTEXT Total sales increased 9.1 percent and comp sales increased 9.5 percent . WRAPTEXT All divisions outpaced ANTAD self-service representing our widest gap to WRAPTEXT the market since 2009 . In Mexico , comp sales increased 14.1 percent on a WRAPTEXT two-year stacked basis driven by strong comp traffic growth . We continue WRAPTEXT to make progress with our digital transformation , and Mexico ’ s omni- WRAPTEXT channel sales , while still fairly small , grew 28 percent during the quarter , WRAPTEXT which includes the expansion of marketplace and the introduction of WRAPTEXT pickup . WRAPTEXT 9 WRAPTEXT In Canada , net sales increased 2.9 percent with comp sales growth of WRAPTEXT 2.6 percent . According to Nielsen we gained market share in key traffic WRAPTEXT driving categories such as food and consumables as well as health and WRAPTEXT wellness . Additionally , we continued to invest in price to further improve WRAPTEXT our position in the market . Lastly , profit was negatively impacted by a WRAPTEXT charge of $ 81 million related to the pending sale of our Canada bank , WRAPTEXT somewhat offset by the sale of land mentioned earlier . WRAPTEXT In China , net sales increased 6.0 percent and comp sales increased WRAPTEXT 4.0 percent , which marks the best comp performance in more than five WRAPTEXT years . We ’ re pleased with the comp performance of both our Walmart and WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club formats , and the flagship stores on JD.com experienced WRAPTEXT significant growth . Additionally , we expanded the one-hour delivery service WRAPTEXT with JD Daojia bringing the total number of stores providing this service to WRAPTEXT 177 . WRAPTEXT Turning to the U.K. , net sales increased 3.7 percent and comp sales WRAPTEXT grew 3.4 percent . The team continues to focus on improving the customer WRAPTEXT experience through price perception and quality private brand products . WRAPTEXT Overall , we ’ re pleased with the consistent performance from WRAPTEXT international . We ’ re positioning the company for continued growth and WRAPTEXT we ’ re confident in our strategy . WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club WRAPTEXT Before I discuss the performance at Sam ’ s , let me remind you that at WRAPTEXT the end of last year , we made the decision to close 63 clubs in the U.S. and WRAPTEXT remove tobacco from certain clubs , which will impact various metrics WRAPTEXT throughout the year . WRAPTEXT Net sales for the quarter decreased 2.7 percent , but this includes a WRAPTEXT negative impact of nearly 8 percent from closed clubs . So , while we will WRAPTEXT have comparability challenges throughout the year , we feel good about the WRAPTEXT current momentum in the underlying business . WRAPTEXT Comp sales , excluding fuel , increased 3.8 percent with comps WRAPTEXT excluding fuel and tobacco increasing 5.2 percent . Comp traffic was strong WRAPTEXT at 5.6 percent . The fresh category continues to perform well with comps of WRAPTEXT greater than 5.0 percent , led by strong traffic growth . We expect tobacco to WRAPTEXT negatively impact sales more as the year progresses . WRAPTEXT 10 WRAPTEXT In eCommerce , we recently announced free shipping from WRAPTEXT Samsclub.com for Plus members . This new benefit is driving more WRAPTEXT members to upgrade to the premium membership , which is providing a nice WRAPTEXT lift to membership income . Overall , eCommerce sales increased WRAPTEXT approximately 25 percent during the quarter .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT John Furner - Walmart Inc. - Executive VP , President & CEO of Sam ’ s Club WRAPTEXT Yes . Good -- thanks , Greg . And remember , last fall , we narrowed our target consumer down to a specific target in WRAPTEXT the income range of $ 75,000 to $ 125,000 . And then we went through a price , location , product , a number of things to ensure that we were doing WRAPTEXT the right thing for those members . And as you can see , the results in the first quarter were good . Traffic was probably the more encouraging number WRAPTEXT even than comp as traffic grew slightly higher than comp . And that 's as we managed the tobacco portfolio down a bit and worked on the rest of WRAPTEXT the box . But overall , the first quarter was encouraging . Areas like fresh food were really solid . Our members ' smart business continues to gain . And WRAPTEXT the majority of the comp was coming from the base of the business more than the transfer .

WRAPTEXT We ’ re shaping our systems to deliver shared value for customers , WRAPTEXT associates , communities and shareholders . It ’ s rewarding work . paragraph: WRAPTEXT Doug McMillon : President & CEO , Walmart Inc. WRAPTEXT We ’ re pleased with the overall results we posted for the third quarter . WRAPTEXT We continue to see strong comp store sales . Our results reflect not only WRAPTEXT value our customers are finding in our offer , and a lot of hard work from the WRAPTEXT team , but certainly some macro tailwinds as well , especially in the U.S. WRAPTEXT Total revenue for the third quarter grew 2.4 percent on a constant currency WRAPTEXT basis , and adjusted EPS increased 8 percent . WRAPTEXT Each of our segments achieved solid sales growth . WRAPTEXT We shared our current thinking and strategy , which is centered around WRAPTEXT accelerating the pace of innovation while maintaining strong execution in WRAPTEXT the day-to-day business . WRAPTEXT 2 WRAPTEXT To give you a sense of the pace of change here at Walmart , I want to WRAPTEXT share a few of the announcements we ’ ve made since that meeting . We ’ ve WRAPTEXT announced : WRAPTEXT • Improvements to our Walmart.com marketplace with millions more WRAPTEXT items available for free two-day shipping and the ability to facilitate WRAPTEXT returns of these items at our over 4,700 U.S. locations ; WRAPTEXT • A new checkout experience in time for the holidays called Check Out WRAPTEXT with Me that lets customers bypass checkout lines and pay for items WRAPTEXT in areas where they ’ re shopping ; WRAPTEXT • The opening of a new test club in Dallas , which will serve as an WRAPTEXT innovation lab for Sam ’ s Club ; WRAPTEXT • A high-tech grocery distribution center in Shafter , California , which WRAPTEXT will move 40 percent more product than a traditional distribution WRAPTEXT center ; WRAPTEXT • A partnership with PayPal to provide financial services and products ; WRAPTEXT • A global initiative with leading consumer brands to tackle plastic WRAPTEXT waste ; WRAPTEXT • A partnership with Jet.com and Blue Apron to offer on-demand meal WRAPTEXT kits for delivery , as well as launching Bonobos and Nike on the Jet WRAPTEXT site ; and WRAPTEXT • A shared services partnership with Genpact WRAPTEXT As you can see , there ’ s a pattern here – our company is moving WRAPTEXT faster and we ’ re accelerating innovation . We ’ re creating a business model WRAPTEXT that functions as an ecosystem with the customer at the center . WRAPTEXT Collectively , we operate through the lens of our four strategic objectives : WRAPTEXT make every day easier for busy families , change how we work , operate WRAPTEXT with discipline and use trust as a competitive advantage . paragraph: WRAPTEXT Brett Biggs WRAPTEXT Great , thank you . Good morning everybody . WRAPTEXT We ’ re really pleased with our first quarter results . Operating income and EPS were better than WRAPTEXT expected . Sales in the US were very solid . We ’ re seeing strong comp sales and market share WRAPTEXT gains and in particular Walmart US had a really strong first quarter . We have a strong WRAPTEXT foundation in place with our stores and we have a large eCommerce business , so we have the WRAPTEXT resources and the capabilities to continue to provide really unique omni-solutions for our WRAPTEXT customers . WRAPTEXT So a few highlights for the quarter . Total revenue is up $ 2.5 billion to $ 125.8 billion constant WRAPTEXT currency , a $ 3.1 billion increase from last year . And currency had a negative impact of WRAPTEXT approximately $ 1.9 billion . Our adjusted EPS of $ 1.13 is ahead of what we expected . Greg and WRAPTEXT Marc will get into the results a little later , but the results are strong . Operating performance , as I WRAPTEXT mentioned in the US and eCommerce . A little less pressure from transportation costs and better WRAPTEXT merchandise mix in both the stores and eCommerce . WRAPTEXT Operating income declined 3 % on a constant currency basis , but was ahead of expectations WRAPTEXT because of the performance I mentioned earlier . We leveraged SG & A expenses of about 14 WRAPTEXT basis points , really strong Walmart US sales and good store productivity , but leverage in every WRAPTEXT part of the business . You ’ ll hear , again as I said , you ’ ll hear from Greg in a minute but we had a WRAPTEXT really strong quarter . Comp sales up 3.4 % , the 19th consecutive quarter of comp sales growth . WRAPTEXT And strong US eCommerce growth of 37 % . Online grocery remains meaningful , but a good WRAPTEXT quarter overall . WRAPTEXT Led by Mexico , international comps were positive in seven of our ten markets . Total sales WRAPTEXT increased 1.2 % in constant currency . And you ’ ll recall that Easter is in a flip for international WRAPTEXT because we report on a one month lag so that would impact sales a bit in the quarter . Solid WRAPTEXT Sam ’ s Club comp sales of 3.0 % , excluding fuel and tobacco and eCommerce sales growth of WRAPTEXT 28 % . WRAPTEXT In regards to tariffs , we continue to monitor the situation . Our goal is always to be the low price WRAPTEXT leader and we ’ ll continue to actively manage pricing and margins with our customers and WRAPTEXT shareholders in mind . Greg will briefly mention how our merchant teams are approaching this . WRAPTEXT We ’ re going to continue to do everything we can to keep prices low , that ’ s who we are . WRAPTEXT However , increased tariffs will lead to increased prices we believe for our customers . So overall , WRAPTEXT we ’ re really pleased with the results . It puts us in a good position to achieve our full-year goals . WRAPTEXT Our underlying business is really strong and the omni strategy is working . And it ’ s been our WRAPTEXT practice that we will update certain full year guidance with our Q2 release . And with that I will WRAPTEXT turn it over to Greg Foran .

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Walmart U.S gross margin rate was better than expected , due primarily to better merchandise WRAPTEXT mix including strength in private brands , less pressure from transportation costs , and improved WRAPTEXT margins in eCommerce , partially offset by continued price investments . paragraph:
Richard Mayfield Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, Walmart International, Walmart                                                                                                                                                     A Yeah. I mean, I think, general trends I think one thing that we see around the world is a customer that's focused on both value and convenience. So, you hear us talking a lot about saving money and time. I think we feel our brand is well positioned for both of those. First one is kind of fairly obvious. We're a low-priced retailer and known for that and continue to invest in prices to win with customers in that sense. And then, on the convenience side of things, as I mentioned previously, we do think that the combination of stores and eCommerce, particularly on that on-demand part of the assortment, the head, is a competitive advantage and one that we're leveraging around the world. I think if I look at some of the specifics, you mentioned China, so I'll spend a little bit of time on China and then refer briefly to Massmart and South Africa in particular. In China, you saw Q1, our comp was 0.4%, the two year I think was 4.4%. One thing to mention, we're in a three- year process of exiting from bulk sales, which essentially a low margin business-to-business sales out of the stores. That has its biggest negative impact this year so that's slightly depressing the comp. Look, we're building again to be the largest omnichannel retailer in that market. We're really excited about the Sam's Club performance continued to be exceptionally strong and we're looking to expand. So I mentioned China new stores,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    8                                                                                                                       

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Sam's Club is a strong element of that. Online is growing pretty rapidly in the Dada O2O piece. So that, as I mentioned earlier, is the fastest growing element. And then in the Walmart business, we're focused very much on smaller formats, so small operator hypermarkets and supermarkets, which we started opening in the country. Just moving to Massmart, yeah, it's a pretty challenging economic environment. In Q1, GDP was a minus 3. And obviously, when you're in a largely discretionary spend, we've got strong positions in general merchandise. So that business has been under a little bit of pressure in the first half of the year. I mean, again, I think with an election out of the way, I think we should start to see some improvement in economic conditions. We have a fairly strong food component to that business, but I'm sure this year is going to be a challenging one with those kind of economic conditions.

paragraph: WRAPTEXT Marc Lore : Thank you , John and good morning everyone . As Brett said , eCommerce sales grew 41 % this WRAPTEXT quarter , which is the highest so far this year . We 're also continuing to significantly improve contributed WRAPTEXT profit , and as Doug said , reducing operating loss is one of our key focus areas . We remain committed to WRAPTEXT our three-part strategy , including nailing the fundamentals of eCommerce , playing offense using our WRAPTEXT unique assets and innovating for the future . In nailing the fundamentals , the Customer Value Index we WRAPTEXT use to measure progress is tracking ahead of where we expected it to be at the end of the year , and WRAPTEXT that 's leading to a higher customer NPS score . WRAPTEXT Next day shipping is doing very well , it 's proving to drive up customer NPS scores and at the same time WRAPTEXT it 's lowering our delivery costs . We 're offering next day to more than 35 % of the population and I 'm WRAPTEXT really happy with how the team 's executed on it . WRAPTEXT We ’ re also continuing to improve our assortment both in first party and marketplace . The assortment WRAPTEXT and the experience in home and fashion is helping to drive overall growth and increased margins . We ’ ve WRAPTEXT been adding to our assortment organically and by leveraging the assortment from the e-tailers we 've WRAPTEXT acquired . In marketplace , we ’ ve dedicated a lot of attention to the customer experience and we ’ ve WRAPTEXT dramatically improve the NPS score . We ’ re now turning our focus to the seller experience , including WRAPTEXT both tools and services . WRAPTEXT John talked about the continued role of grocery delivery and how well customers are responding to that WRAPTEXT service . Our fresh business has a unique advantage in the eCommerce space and I 'm excited about WRAPTEXT Delivery Unlimited scaling to 1,400 stores last week . As we drive a deep connection with customers in WRAPTEXT grocery , we ’ re able to offer our extended assortment through our Supercenters and on Walmart.com . WRAPTEXT We ’ re focusing a lot of energy on making that connection . WRAPTEXT Also looking further out , we ’ re innovating for the future . In-home delivery is something we ’ ve incubated WRAPTEXT in Store No . 8 , and after initial testing we decided to graduate it into the core business . Bart Stein ’ s team WRAPTEXT and the service moved into the customer org as it begins to roll out more broadly , it ’ s now available in WRAPTEXT three cities representing more than a million people . It 's a great example of pushing the limits of how WRAPTEXT we can create convenience for customers . WRAPTEXT In summary , after delivering 37 % , 37 % , and 41 % in the first three quarters , respectively , we 're on track WRAPTEXT to deliver 35 % growth for the full year . We ’ re tracking toward the range we gave in the beginning of the WRAPTEXT year of 30-40 % growth each of the quarters , with the lowest growth come in Q4 . We ’ re continuing to WRAPTEXT push on growing the business , while focused on reducing the operating loss and we 're really excited WRAPTEXT about our customer offers on the experience throughout the holidays . Thank you . WRAPTEXT Randy : So with that I think we ’ re ready to open the lines for questions .

paragraph: Brett M. Biggs Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President,                                                                                                                                                                              A Yeah. [ph] We kind of – the last time that Sam's is the smallest (00:17:45) $60 billion business in the world, because it's a really big business. It didn't quite get as much attention, because it sits inside such a big company. But it's been a part of who we are as a company, has Sam's name on it, which matters to a lot of us. I spent time at Sam's, Doug spent time at Sam's. What I loved about this quarter is the membership growth that we're seeing. And remember, we closed a number of clubs, a couple of years ago and we have now more members than we did even before we closed those clubs. So, membership growth is growing. The way they've got the financial model structure, gross margin expenses, how they're using membership income is really how the club business should work. I mean, it's really healthy business. Nice growth, excluding fuel and tobacco, and we've been pulling some out of the tobacco business and so that's been intentional. But I'll – they've led the company in some ways in technology, some of the things they've done with [ph] Agile (00:18:45) teams, what they've done with Scan & Go have I've led the company in some ways from that perspective. So, I'm really excited about what's going on at Sam's. International, there're some markets that have performed really well. Walmex is another one, Walmex gets not near enough credit for the business they are. They are one of the finest retailers in the world when you look at being multi-format, the growth that they have every year, it's an amazing business, generates a ton of cash flow. The UK has been challenged with Brexit and the [ph] consumer is (00:19:15) struggling there with what's going to be long term in the UK. And so, that's been a bit of a challenging market. We're really excited about opportunities in China and India. There's only two countries in the world with 1.3 billion people and that's two of them. So, we're in both of those markets. We have great growth opportunities there. And so, it's – international has different pieces that together makes sense. So, good opportunities for both businesses.
